titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Chancellor of the University of Pittsburgh, J. Dennis O'Connor, Administrative Files, 1991-1995 UA.2.10.1991-1995
titlestmt.author: Kathleen Donahoe.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:14:15 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Chancellor of the University of Pittsburgh, J. Dennis O'Connor, Administrative Files
did.abstract: This collection is comprised of material relating to J. Dennis O'Connor's tenure as Chancellor of the University of Pittsburgh from 1991-1995. It includes material regarding ongoing developments with the university, the changing relationship with the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center (UPMC), and Chancellor O'Connor's actions in the larger community.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: J. Dennis O'Connor served as the sixteenth chancellor of the University of Pittsburgh from 1991 until his resignation in 1995. During his term he struggled with budget issues and the ramifications of Chancellor Wesley Posvar's controversial retirement plan. He worked to increase diversity at the university, implementing several different affirmative action programs for undergraduate and graduate students. O'Connor also oversaw the construction of Sutherland Hall, an undergraduate dormitory on upper campus, as well as the development of a Master Space Plan for Pitt.

O'Connor came to Pitt from the University of North Carolina (UNC), where he served as vice chancellor of academic affairs and provost, making him the highest-ranking academic official at the school. Prior to his time at UNC, O'Connor also served in several positions at the University of Southern California, including dean of the division of life science and chair of the biology department. He also served as a visiting professor at Monash University in Melbourne, Australia, and University of Nijmegan in Holland. O'Connor earned his B.S. from Loyola University in Chicago, his hometown. He earned a master's degree from DePaul University, and received his Ph.D. from Northwestern University in 1968.

After stepping back from the chancellorship, O'Connor intended to take on a faculty position in the department of biology at Pitt. In December 1995, however, O'Connor left Pitt for the Smithsonian Institute, serving as Provost of that institution. He was also briefly the acting director of the National Museum of Natural History. In 2002 he left the Smithsonian for the University of Maryland, College Park to serve as their head of research and dean of graduate studies. He resigned from that role in 2004.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged with respect to the original order created by the Office of the Chancellor. This includes retaining the structure of their filing system, referred to as the Mail Log Files. Material was kept in the categories decided upon by staff at the time of its creation, with exceptions to those documents shown to be obviously misfiled. The categories for the mail log are as follows:
03. Office of the Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs
09. Senior Vice Chancellor for Health Sciences
11. Senior Vice Chancellor for Business & Finance and Treasurer

Each of these 13 categories has subcategories that follow, with individual number assignments of their own. These are included in the folder titles of the files in the collection. It should be noted that for the first year of Chancellor O'Connor's tenure, the Office of the Chancellor used the same numbering system as Chancellor Posvar's office did; this changes with FY1993 and remains the same for the rest of his time as chancellor. The files from that first year have been grouped with those of the same subject, but their title reflects this different mail log number.
The overall collection is divided into four series:

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Chancellor of the University of Pittsburgh, J. Dennis O'Connor, Administrative Files, 1991-1995, UA.2.10.1991-1995, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Material in complaint files (1.10, 1.11, 1.12, 1.13, 5.12) has been restricted to protect the privacy of those writing to the Chancellor's Office. Researchers accessing these files will be required to sign a confidentiality agreement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The administrative files of J. Dennis O'Connor contain materials relating to all aspects of O'Connor's time as leader of the University of Pittsburgh, from 1991-1995. O'Connor began his time as "President" of the university, a holdover from the time of Wesley Posvar, but later asked the Board of Trustees to change the title back to "Chancellor." The records generally consist of correspondence, meeting minutes and supplementary materials, internal reports, university publications, chronological files, and speeches. It should be noted that many of the files in the O'Connor papers were facsimile printouts on heat transfer paper, which fades over time. As a result, all faxes have been photocopied and the originals removed from the collection.

The first series contains material sorted in the Office of the Chancellor's Mail Log File system, where every document has been previously categorized and sorted by the Chancellor's staff. Material within each mail log designation is sorted by fiscal year, which for the university begins on July 1st and ends June 30th of the next year (i.e., Fiscal Year 1992 is July 1, 1991 - June 30, 1992). Since Chancellor O'Connor stepped down on August 1, 1995, there is some material from FY1996 in the collection despite his only having been in office for one month of the fiscal year.

Chancellor O'Connor's collection continues after the mail log files with his chronological files, consisting of outgoing correspondence which may duplicate material present in the first series; his speeches, given at both Pitt and non-Pitt events; and subject files for materials not included in the mail log.

Areas of specific interest in the records may include the continuing development of Pitt's relationship with the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center (UPMC), increased development of affirmative action programs by the chancellor, and the creation of the university's Master Plan.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Kathleen Donahoe from 2018 to 2020.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Office of the Chancellor in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The material in Series I comes from the mail log files and represents the bulk of the collection. The mail log files represent a filing structure put in place by the Chancellor's Office, creating categorizations for the records of that office. Their original order and assignments of mail log locations are retained here. The files of the mail log include correspondence, meeting materials, reports, and other publications. In a few exceptional cases there may be photographs included with the materials.

The mail log files are arranged in order of ascending log number, and then within those categories chronologically by fiscal year. Chancellor O'Connor's materials include some in FY1996 because he did not step down officially until after the new fiscal year started.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The 1.0 Mail Log file contains those records that directly relate to the Office of the Chancellor. These include materials specific to Chancellor O'Connor, such as correspondence not directly related to the operations of the university, memberships to boards of directors and trustees on which he served, activities overseen directly by the Office of the Chancellor, and records of Senior and Executive Staff meetings. The material in mail logs 1.10, 1.11, 1.12, and 1.25 are restricted and require a signed confidentiality agreement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Materials in the 2.0 Mail Log files are directly concerned with the Board of Trustees of the University of Pittsburgh, and the committees created from its members. These include individual committee correspondence and meeting files, as well as correspondence with the Chancellor concerning various representatives to the Board and its committees.

Office of the Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The 3.0 Mail Log files deal specifically with the Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs, as well as most student activities. This includes those records relating to student organizations and activities such as homecoming, the Pitt News, fraternities and sororities, and the Student Government Board. The records include correspondence, some event plans, and program information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Material in the 4.0 Mail Log files pertains to the activities of the Office for Institutional Advancement. It includes information on major grant awards sought and received by the university, particularly through the grant reports and acknowledgement letters from Chancellor O'Connor in 04.06.06. Major foundations that the university consistently interacted with, such as the Hillman Foundation, have their own individual files. These records also include material relating to alumni, such as correspondence with and regarding the Alumni Association and major events on the university's calendar, such as Honors Convocation and Commencement. It also covers the Office of Special Events and the various programming efforts established by that office. The bulk of the material for events listed after 4.9 consists of guest lists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The files in the 5.0 Mail Log focus on the Department of Athletics at the University of Pittsburgh. This includes information on planning football game events, discussion of Pitt Stadium issues and potential fundraising, correspondence with the Athletic Director and head coaches, and more. The Pitt Band is also periodically represented in records here. Material in Mail Log 5.12 has been restricted and requires a signed confidentiality agreement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The files in the 6.0 Mail Log concern the University of Pittsburgh's Senate and Faculty Assembly. There are meeting minutes and information on the overall organizations, as well as the Senate's individual committees. Some correspondence and reports are also available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The files in the 7.0 Mail Log contain reports, policies and statements relating to affirmative action at the university. Topics include complaints and evaluations of discrimination, racism and harassment, as well as Title IX violations. Affirmative Action data reports, which contain information about hiring and enrollment demographics, are also present.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The 8.0 Mail Log files contain material on everything that falls under the purview of the Office of the Provost. This includes material on individual schools and centers that report to the Provost, the Boards of Visitors for these schools, the University Library System, the Nationality Rooms Program, the Semester at Sea program, the Institute of Politics, and material on the four branch campuses of the University of Pittsburgh. The records include correspondence between administrators as well as faculty members, departmental information, reports, some publications, meeting information, and future plans for the different reporting groups.

Senior Vice Chancellor for Health Sciences

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The 9.0 Mail Log contains everything related to the Health Sciences at the University of Pittsburgh. This includes correspondence with the Senior Vice Chancellor for Health Sciences, Thomas Detre, and material from the National Science Foundation. It also includes correspondence and other materials on the schools that report to the Senior Vice Chancellor for Health Sciences: Medicine, Dental Medicine, Health and Rehabilitation Sciences, Nursing, Pharmacy and Public Health. These records also include correspondence and reports from the individual schools' Boards of Visitors. Materials involving relationships with federal and local entities, such as the National Science Foundation, are also present here.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records in this subseries focus on the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center, or UPMC. They include the meeting minutes of the Board of Directors for UPMC and other hospitals. They also include correspondence and information relating to the acquisition by UPMC of various hospitals and centers in the region. In addition, it contains material regarding the University of Pittsburgh Cancer Institute as well as the Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic.

Senior Vice Chancellor for Business & Finance and Treasurer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The material in the 11 Mail Log contains records of the Senior Vice Chancellor for Business & Finance and Treasurer, and the various departments and offices this position oversaw. The material in these files includes information on annual budget requests and appropriations from the state; capital projects planning; information on and correspondence from departments such as Public Safety, Property Management, and Human Resources; and information on the university's Master Space Plan in 11.8.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The material in the 12.0 Mail Log files relates to the various associations and organizations to which the University of Pittsburgh and Chancellor O'Connor belonged or with whom they interacted. They include meeting minutes, publications, and correspondence of organizations, as well as event information in some cases. Of particular interest here are the files concerning the Allegheny Conference on Community Development (12.01), which provides a look into the university's expanding role in the region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The material in the 13.0 Mail Log primarily concerns other universities, such as Carnegie Mellon University, Penn State University, and Duquesne University. The materials here include correspondence between Chancellor O'Connor and his counterparts at the other institutions, as well as information on activities and job openings from the other schools.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The files in Series II include those that could be considered subject files – those that do not fit into the mail log numbering but represent specific topics for O'Connor's research and work as chancellor. These include mostly meeting materials for the Chancellor's Executive Staff Meetings, but also some copies of remarks and agendas for semi-annual Board of Trustees meetings and information on the NCAA Infractions report prepared by the university.

did.unittitle: Business Higher Education Forum European trip
NCAA Infractions - Exhibits for Governance and Compliance
NCAA Infractions - Pitt report, including exhibits
Search for the Senior Vice Chancellor for Business & Finance

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The chronological files for Chancellor O'Connor's administrative records are comprised of outgoing mail directly from O'Connor. They are sorted by date, reflecting the original organization from the Chancellor's Office. The records in this series may complement or duplicate material already found in the mail log records in Series I.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Series IV consists of the speeches given by O'Connor during his time as chancellor. They are sorted individually by date, retaining the original order in which they were organized by the Chancellor's Office. Files here generally consist of a transcript of O'Connor's remarks for a given event, though sometimes there are only brief notes or talking points for him to cover. Some events also include supplementary material, such as event programs or brief, related correspondence, but this is not the case for every event. Some items in this series are not actual speeches, but rather messages written as a greeting or commentary from the chancellor for publication. An index of speeches is available at the beginning of the series, though some speeches found in the series are not necessarily present in this index.
